name: Mummy
description: A Mummy is an undead creature wrapped in decayed bandages, exuding an aura of dread that instills fear in its enemies. Its body is preserved through ancient embalming techniques, giving it a command over death and decay.
memorable: The Mummy's touch brings forth a deadly curse called Mummy Rot, relentlessly weakening its victims over time.
goals: To guard the resting places of ancient kings and priests, fulfilling its duty in death as it did in life.
relations: May serve or be master of other undead creatures, particularly those tied to ancient tombs.
environment: Typically found in tombs, pyramids, or other ancient sites steeped in curses.
strengths: High resilience against many forms of damage, particularly nonmagical attacks, and immunity to necrotic damage.
weaknesses: Low Dexterity makes it vulnerable to ranged attacks and quick opponents.
attacks: Able to execute a multiattack with a Dreadful Glare to frighten or paralyze, followed by a powerful Rotting Fist attack that deals both bludgeoning and necrotic damage.
most_powerful_ability: The Mummy Rot curse, which prevents healing and reduces the hit point maximum over time, potentially leading to death.
skills: Resistant to many conditions, showcasing exceptional durability against effects like charm and paralysis.
additional_information: Catches fire after taking fire damage, resulting in ongoing damage.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Can communicate in the languages it knew in life, primarily in combat.
Possesses undead resilience enhancing its survivability.
Strikes fear into enemies with its mere presence.
test_queries: undead creature that inflicts cursed rot
